subject: Business
title: Capital Gains Tax: Selling Winners
description: Learn Capital Gains Tax: Selling Winners in one minute.

hook.text: You sell a stock for $10,000 profit. Uncle Sam takes $1,500 â€” or $3,700, depending on how long you held it.

buildup.text: Capital gains tax applies to profits from selling investments. Long-term (held 1+ year) rates are lower than short-term.

discovery.text: Short-term gains are taxed as ordinary income (up to 37%). Long-term gains top out at 20% for most investors.

twist.text: Tax-loss harvesting lets you sell losers to offset gains, reducing your tax bill while maintaining your portfolio.

climax.text: Billionaires often 'buy, borrow, die' â€” hold assets (no tax), borrow against them (no income), pass them on (stepped-up.

punchline.text: It's not what you earn. It's what you keep after taxes.

quiz.question: Why are long-term capital gains taxed at a lower rate?
options: To incentivize holding investments for longer periods rather than frequent trading
Because long-term investments are always riskier
The government doesn't track long-term gains
